intro: Tibouchina meiodon, commonly known as the pink flame bush, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble flames. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and produces clusters of tubular, pink to red flowers. Tibouchina meiodon thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
